Este documento contiene los resultados d: This document contains the results of the thermographic inspection carried out at the photovoltaic solar plant in
Las inspecciones termográficas en instal: Thermographic inspections in photovoltaic solar power plants are part of the preventive maintenance recommended for this type of installations and are aimed at anticipating those problems in the panels that are not easily detectable in any other way.
Es importante que este mantenimiento sea: It is important that this maintenance is carried out by professionals, since a poorly performed thermography over several years can affect the general condition of the plant.
Entre las ventajas de realizar termograf: Among the advantages of performing infrared thermography on a regular basis: it allows to increase the efficiency of the plant (performance ratio) in the medium term, avoid more expensive repairs, increase the useful life of the equipment, detect problems related to different panel manufacturers, problems of connection between modules, problems related to vegetation or dirt on the modules ... among a long list of advantages.
La inspección ha sido realizada mediante: The inspection has been carried out by means of unmanned aerial vehicles operated and designed for this purpose
Se ha utilizado la más avanzada tecnolog: The most advanced technology at the service of photovoltaics has been used in order to minimize time and cost of operation without sacrificing the highest quality and reliability. The team that has produced this document has trained personnel in Infrared Thermography Level 1.
ha seguido para realizar esta inspección: has continued to carry out this thermographic inspection is the international standard for thermographic inspections IEC 62446-3. It defines how infrared thermography of photovoltaic modules must be carried out in plants during their operation
Hay dos niveles de inspección termográfi: There are two levels of thermographic inspection according to IEC 62446-3:
Esta es una inspección limitada para ver: This is a limited inspection to verify that the modules are working, with reduced requirements for personnel. This type of inspection is used, for example, during a basic commissioning of a photovoltaic plant
Requiere una comprensión más profunda de: It requires a deeper understanding of thermal abnormalities. It can be used for periodic inspections in accordance with the IEC 62446 series and for troubleshooting problems with poor performance. Absolute temperature measurements are performed. A licensed expert in photovoltaic plants, together with thermographic exports, they can carry out this type of inspection
La termografía realizada entra dentro de: The thermography performed falls within the detailed inspections indicated by the standard, complying with the requirements indicated therein, which are:
Medición absoluta de temperaturas: con u: Absolute measurement of temperatures: with an error of less than 2 ºC.
Medición de temperatura máxima, media y: Maximum, average and gradient temperature measurement.
Informe realizado por un experto en term: Report made by an expert in infrared thermography in conjunction with a photovoltaic expert.
Recomendación para cada tipo de anomalía: Recommendation for each type of abnormality registered.
Resolución geométrica térmica: 5x5 pixel: Thermal geometric resolution: 5x5 pixels for each photovoltaic cell.
Resolución geométrica visual: 25x25 pixe: Visual geometric resolution: 25x25 pixels for each photovoltaic cell.
Condiciones ambientales correctas: tempe: Correct environmental conditions: ambient temperature, wind, cloud coverage and irradiance.
Parámetros térmicos: el ajuste de la emi: Thermal parameters: the adjustment of the emissivity and the reflected temperature is essential for a correct measurement of the temperatures. It is necessary to make the appropriate measurements in the field in order to obtain these parameters, since they depend on the atmosphere, the weather, the dirt on the modules on the day of the flight and on the materials of the module itself.
Documentación: el entregable incluye las: Documentation: the deliverable includes the original radiometric and visual images along with all the data required by the standard.
Trayectoria: que asegure el cumplimiento: Path: to ensure compliance with the standard.
evolución de las anomalías térmicas con: evolution of thermal abnormalities over time
comparando inspecciones termográficas ll: comparing thermographic inspections carried out in different months or years (with different environmental conditions), it is necessary to have a procedure that allows the temperature gradients to be normalized.
Por este motivo todas las anomalías regi: For this reason, all the abnormalities registered have their 'normalized gradient' associated, which is the temperature gradient equivalent to having carried out the inspection with an irradiance of 1000 W / m2. This will allow the results of this inspection to be compared with other future ones carried out under different environmental conditions and thus to have a reliable evolution of each one of the abnormalities.

La temperatura reflejada nos depende de: The reflected temperature depends on the atmosphere and the meteorological conditions of the day of the flight. El coeficiente de rendimiento de sistema: The performance coefficient of photovoltaic systems or Performance Ratio is a parameter that had its conceptual origin in the IES 61724 (1998) standard to be used as a quality indicator in the evaluation of photovoltaic systems.
Este parámetro se utiliza para medir el: This parameter is used to measure the performance of any photovoltaic system. In other words, if we want to know if a module is generating the energy it should, it would be enough to know its PR. We cannot know the PR of each module with a thermography, but what we can know is the loss of PR (ΔPR) produced by thermal abnormality with respect to its ideal conditions. That is, a module with a hot spot that causes ΔPR = -1% is less important than an abnormality that causes ΔPR = -33%, which is causing the module's electrical output to drop by 33%.
La pérdida de PR nos indica, por tanto,: The loss of PR indicates, therefore, how damaging a thermal abnormality is, explicitly identifying the points on which action must be taken to optimize electrical production. It is an indispensable parameter in the thermographic diagnosis of a photovoltaic installation, since it allows us to make decisions based on objective technical-economic data.
Para poder evaluar la planta utilizaremo: In order to evaluate the plant we will use the following two simple concepts:
Cada incidencia tiene una variación de p: Each abnormalities has an associated performance ratio variation. For example, an open circuit bypass diode causes the module to work at 15% efficiency in a typical case (ΔPR = 85%), while an isolated hot cell produces on average <1% losses.
El concepto 'módulos apagados equivalent: The concept 'equivalent shutdown modules' is the equivalent number of modules that do not generate energy due to abnormalities registered in the plant. For example, if we have three identical modules with a defect in one bypass diode each, each module generates 33% less energy. So the number of equivalent shutdown modules is 1.
Uniendo los dos conceptos anteriores, se: Uniting the two previous concepts, a rough estimation can be made of the variation of PR of the plant in the following way:
Siendo N = Número de módulos; PR = Perfo: Being N = Number of modules; PR = Performance ratio; MAE = Calculated equivalent shutdown modules
Por lo tanto, sabiendo el MAE sabremos c: Therefore, knowing the MAE we will know how much PR we are losing due to the abnormalities encountered.
El objetivo será obtener un MAE bajo, lo: The objective will be to obtain a low MAE, which will indicate correct plant maintenance.
Teniendo en cuenta todas las plantas fot: Taking into account all the photovoltaic plants inspected
se puede hacer una clasificación estadís: a statistical classification can be made according to the MAE. According to the following table, we can classify the maintenance of a plant into 3 types: very good (below average), correct (on average) and 'can improve' (above average):
Cómo se clasifican las anomalías térmica: How thermal abnormalities are classified (according to IEC 62446-3)
According to the international standard: According to the international standard IEC 62446-3 for thermographic inspections of photovoltaic installations, thermal abnormalities are classified into three classes or CoA (Class of Abnormalitys):
hacemos seguimiento, pero no hay que act: we follow up, but no imminent action is needed.
ver la causa y, si es necesario, arregla: checking the cause and, ifnecessary, rectification in areasonable period.
próxima interrupción de la operación nor: prompt interruption of operation, checking the cause and rectification in a reasonable period
Todas las incidencias tienen asociada un: All abnormalities have a GPS location associated with an error margin of a few meters (0-2 meters).

Esta clasificación tiene como fin detect: The purpose of this classification is to detect possible problems related to the position of each module. From this analysis, problems related to the vegetation of the facility, bird depositions, etc. are obtained.
El MAE (módulo apagados equivalentes) no: The MAE (equivalent shutdown module) gives us a qualitative measure of the impact of abnormalities recorded in the plant's PR (performance ratio).
Según la norma internacional IEC 62446-3: According to the international standard IEC 62446-3 for thermographic inspections of photovoltaic installations, thermal abnormalities are classified into three classes or CoA (Class of Abnormalitys):
Célula caliente: Single cell with difference in temperature
Varias células calientes: Several cells with difference in temperature
